speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: SCENE III. A room in Capulet's house.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Enter LADY CAPULET and Nurse

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Nurse, where's my daughter? call her forth to me.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Now, by my maidenhead, at twelve year old,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I bade her come. What, lamb! what, ladybird!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: God forbid! Where's this girl? What, Juliet!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Enter JULIET

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: How now! who calls?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Your mother.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Madam, I am here.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: What is your will?

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: This is the matter:--Nurse, give leave awhile,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: We must talk in secret:--nurse, come back again;

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: I have remember'd me, thou's hear our counsel.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Thou know'st my daughter's of a pretty age.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Faith, I can tell her age unto an hour.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: She's not fourteen.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I'll lay fourteen of my teeth,--

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: And yet, to my teeth be it spoken, I have but four--

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: She is not fourteen. How long is it now

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: To Lammas-tide?

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: A fortnight and odd days.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Even or odd, of all days in the year,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Come Lammas-eve at night shall she be fourteen.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Susan and she--God rest all Christian souls!--

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Were of an age: well, Susan is with God;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: She was too good for me: but, as I said,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: On Lammas-eve at night shall she be fourteen;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: That shall she, marry; I remember it well.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: 'Tis since the earthquake now eleven years;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: And she was wean'd,--I never shall forget it,--

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Of all the days of the year, upon that day:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: For I had then laid wormwood to my dug,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Sitting in the sun under the dove-house wall;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: My lord and you were then at Mantua:--

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Nay, I do bear a brain:--but, as I said,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: When it did taste the wormwood on the nipple

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Of my dug and felt it bitter, pretty fool,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: To see it tetchy and fall out with the dug!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Shake quoth the dove-house: 'twas no need, I trow,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: To bid me trudge:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: And since that time it is eleven years;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: For then she could stand alone; nay, by the rood,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: She could have run and waddled all about;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: For even the day before, she broke her brow:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: And then my husband--God be with his soul!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: A' was a merry man--took up the child:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: 'Yea,' quoth he, 'dost thou fall upon thy face?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Thou wilt fall backward when thou hast more wit;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Wilt thou not, Jule?' and, by my holidame,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: The pretty wretch left crying and said 'Ay.'

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: To see, now, how a jest shall come about!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I warrant, an I should live a thousand years,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I never should forget it: 'Wilt thou not, Jule?' quoth he;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: And, pretty fool, it stinted and said 'Ay.'

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Enough of this; I pray thee, hold thy peace.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Yes, madam: yet I cannot choose but laugh,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: To think it should leave crying and say 'Ay.'

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: And yet, I warrant, it had upon its brow

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: A bump as big as a young cockerel's stone;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: A parlous knock; and it cried bitterly:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: 'Yea,' quoth my husband,'fall'st upon thy face?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Thou wilt fall backward when thou comest to age;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Wilt thou not, Jule?' it stinted and said 'Ay.'

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And stint thou too, I pray thee, nurse, say I.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Peace, I have done. God mark thee to his grace!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Thou wast the prettiest babe that e'er I nursed:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: An I might live to see thee married once,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I have my wish.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Marry, that 'marry' is the very theme

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: I came to talk of. Tell me, daughter Juliet,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: How stands your disposition to be married?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: It is an honour that I dream not of.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: An honour! were not I thine only nurse,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I would say thou hadst suck'd wisdom from thy teat.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Well, think of marriage now; younger than you,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Here in Verona, ladies of esteem,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Are made already mothers: by my count,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: I was your mother much upon these years

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: That you are now a maid. Thus then in brief:

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: The valiant Paris seeks you for his love.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: A man, young lady! lady, such a man

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: As all the world--why, he's a man of wax.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Verona's summer hath not such a flower.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Nay, he's a flower; in faith, a very flower.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: What say you? can you love the gentleman?

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: This night you shall behold him at our feast;

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Read o'er the volume of young Paris' face,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: And find delight writ there with beauty's pen;

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Examine every married lineament,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: And see how one another lends content

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: And what obscured in this fair volume lies

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Find written in the margent of his eyes.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: This precious book of love, this unbound lover,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: To beautify him, only lacks a cover:

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: The fish lives in the sea, and 'tis much pride

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: For fair without the fair within to hide:

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: That book in many's eyes doth share the glory,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: That in gold clasps locks in the golden story;

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: So shall you share all that he doth possess,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: By having him, making yourself no less.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: No less! nay, bigger; women grow by men.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Speak briefly, can you like of Paris' love?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I'll look to like, if looking liking move:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: But no more deep will I endart mine eye

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Than your consent gives strength to make it fly.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Enter a Servant

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Madam, the guests are come, supper served up, you

speaker: Servant
text_entry: called, my young lady asked for, the nurse cursed in

speaker: Servant
text_entry: the pantry, and every thing in extremity. I must

speaker: Servant
text_entry: hence to wait; I beseech you, follow straight.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: We follow thee.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Juliet, the county stays.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Go, girl, seek happy nights to happy days.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Exeunt
